transform_width.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_ARCHIVE_ITERATORS_TRANSFORM_WIDTH_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_ARCHIVE_ITERATORS_TRANSFORM_WIDTH_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // transform_width.hpp
00011 
00012 // (C) Copyright 2002 Robert Ramey - http://www.rrsd.com . 
00013 // Use, modification and distribution is subject to the Boost Software
00014 // License, Version 1.0. (See accompanying file LICENSE_1_0.txt or copy at
00015 // http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
00016 
00017 //  See http://www.boost.org for updates, documentation, and revision history.
00018 
00019 // iterator which takes elements of x bits and returns elements of y bits.
00020 // used to change streams of 8 bit characters into streams of 6 bit characters.
00021 // and vice-versa for implementing base64 encodeing/decoding. Be very careful
00022 // when using and end iterator.  end is only reliable detected when the input
00023 // stream length is some common multiple of x and y.  E.G. Base64 6 bit
00024 // character and 8 bit bytes. Lowest common multiple is 24 => 4 6 bit characters
00025 // or 3 8 bit characters
00026 
00027 #include <boost/config.hpp> // for BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME & PTFO
00028 #include <boost/serialization/pfto.hpp>
00029 
00030 #include <boost/iterator/iterator_adaptor.hpp>
00031 #include <boost/iterator/iterator_traits.hpp>
00032 
00033 namespace boost { 
00034 namespace archive {
00035 namespace iterators {
00036 
00038 // class used by text archives to translate char strings to wchar_t
00039 // strings of the currently selected locale
00040 template<
00041     class Base, 
00042     int BitsOut, 
00043     int BitsIn, 
00044     class CharType = BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME boost::iterator_value<Base>::type // output character
00045 >
00046 class transform_width : 
00047     public boost::iterator_adaptor<
00048         transform_width<Base, BitsOut, BitsIn, CharType>,
00049         Base,
00050         CharType,
00051         single_pass_traversal_tag,
00052         CharType
00053     >
00054 {
00055     friend class boost::iterator_core_access;
00056     typedef BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME boost::iterator_adaptor<
00057         transform_width<Base, BitsOut, BitsIn, CharType>,
00058         Base,
00059         CharType,
00060         single_pass_traversal_tag,
00061         CharType
00062     > super_t;
00063 
00064     typedef transform_width<Base, BitsOut, BitsIn, CharType> this_t;
00065     typedef BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME iterator_value<Base>::type base_value_type;
00066 
00067     CharType fill();
00068 
00069     CharType dereference_impl(){
00070         if(! m_full){
00071             m_current_value = fill();
00072             m_full = true;
00073         }
00074         return m_current_value;
00075     }
00076 
00077     CharType dereference() const {
00078         return const_cast<this_t *>(this)->dereference_impl();
00079     }
00080 
00081     // test for iterator equality
00082     bool equal(const this_t & rhs) const {
00083         return
00084             this->base_reference() == rhs.base_reference();
00085         ;
00086     }
00087 
00088     void increment(){
00089         m_displacement += BitsOut;
00090 
00091         while(m_displacement >= BitsIn){
00092             m_displacement -= BitsIn;
00093             if(0 == m_displacement)
00094                 m_bufferfull = false;
00095             if(! m_bufferfull){
00096                 // note: suspect that this is not invoked for borland
00097                 ++(this->base_reference());
00098             }
00099         }
00100         m_full = false;
00101     }
00102 
00103     CharType m_current_value;
00104     // number of bits left in current input character buffer
00105     unsigned int m_displacement;
00106     base_value_type m_buffer;
00107     // flag to current output character is ready - just used to save time
00108     bool m_full;
00109     // flag to indicate that m_buffer has data
00110     bool m_bufferfull;
00111 
00112 public:
00113     // make composible buy using templated constructor
00114     template<class T>
00115     transform_width(BOOST_PFTO_WRAPPER(T) start) : 
00116         super_t(Base(BOOST_MAKE_PFTO_WRAPPER(static_cast<T>(start)))),
00117         m_displacement(0),
00118         m_full(false),
00119         m_bufferfull(false)
00120     {}
00121     // intel 7.1 doesn't like default copy constructor
00122     transform_width(const transform_width & rhs) : 
00123         super_t(rhs.base_reference()),
00124         m_current_value(rhs.m_current_value),
00125         m_displacement(rhs.m_displacement),
00126         m_buffer(rhs.m_buffer),
00127         m_full(rhs.m_full),
00128         m_bufferfull(rhs.m_bufferfull)
00129     {}
00130 };
00131 
00132 template<class Base, int BitsOut, int BitsIn, class CharType>
00133 CharType transform_width<Base, BitsOut, BitsIn, CharType>::fill(){
00134     CharType retval = 0;
00135     unsigned int missing_bits = BitsOut;
00136     for(;;){
00137         unsigned int bcount;
00138         if(! m_bufferfull){
00139             m_buffer = * this->base_reference();
00140             m_bufferfull = true;
00141             bcount = BitsIn;
00142         }
00143         else
00144             bcount = BitsIn - m_displacement;
00145         unsigned int i = (std::min)(bcount, missing_bits);
00146         // shift interesting bits to least significant position
00147         unsigned int j = m_buffer >> (bcount - i);
00148         // strip off uninteresting bits
00149         // (note presumption of two's complement arithmetic)
00150         j &= ~(-(1 << i));
00151         // append then interesting bits to the output value
00152         retval <<= i;
00153         retval |= j;
00154         missing_bits -= i;
00155         if(0 == missing_bits)
00156             break;
00157         // note: suspect that this is not invoked for borland 5.51
00158         ++(this->base_reference());
00159         m_bufferfull = false;
00160     }
00161     return retval;
00162 }
00163 
00164 } // namespace iterators
00165 } // namespace archive
00166 } // namespace boost
00167 
00168 #endif // BOOST_ARCHIVE_ITERATORS_TRANSFORM_WIDTH_HPP
